document_title: Viral fever: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Viral fever can occur at any age, in which high-risk groups include:
Having close contact with someone infected with the virus; Being near infected animals or slaughtering them; Traveling or going to an area where there is an "epidemic" of viral fever; Having sex without safe measures with an infected person; Babies, young children and the elderly due to weak immune systems
Children are susceptible to viral fever
subsection_title: sot sieu vi.json. Subjects susceptible to viral fever
